Evidence Statements: The student can draw how the ice looks before it starts melting.
The student can illustrate what happens when ice is heated and turns into water.
The student can show that when the water is cooled again, it turns back into ice.
The student can represent the concept that the ice melting and freezing again is a reversible change.
The student can include signs or labels to make clear what is happening during each stage of heating and cooling.
